history.content:
1. Course staff hiring in general is over. TA's needed to be hired by the end of October. Some classes may still be going and sometimes budgets get readjusted closer to the start of semester, but overwhelmingly things are already done.

2. I am sure it depends on staff to staff, but for 61B we do not accept resumes. We look for prior teaching experience (interning, CSM, TAing other classes) but nothing formal.

3. I am not sure what you mean by "experience section". Are you talking about the online ASE app? Most classes will release a supplemental which is more important than filling that out. Prior teaching experience is nice, but high school tutoring will not carry much weight.

4. 8hrs a week and 20hrs a week are the only options for the majority of classes.

5. Depends on the class. AI is not a course staff position and is unpaid. It is an intro to teaching that big lower divs have. readers grade assignments in math based classes and also conduct office hours. Tutors might teach small sections, grade assignments, and conduct OH. TAs teach a section and or lab, conduct OH, grade, proctor, and do a lot of other behind the scenes work for their class.

1. Course staff hiring in general is over. TA's needed to be hired by the end of October. Some classes may still be going and sometimes budgets get readjusted closer to the start of semester, but overwhelmingly things are already done.

2. I am sure it depends on staff to staff, but for 61B we do not accept resumes. We look for prior teaching experience (interning, CSM, TAing other classes) but nothing formal.

3. I am not sure what you mean by "experience section". Are you talking about the online ASE app? Most classes will release a supplemental which is more important than filling that out. Prior teaching experience is nice, but high school tutoring will not carry much weight.

4. 8hrs a week and 20hrs a week are the only options for the majority of classes.

5. Depends on the class. AI is not a course staff position and is unpaid. It is an intro to teaching that big lower divs have. readers grade assignments in math based classes and probably also conduct office hours. Tutors might teach small sections, grade assignments, and conduct OH. TAs teach a section and or lab, conduct OH, grade, proctor, and do a lot of other behind the scenes work for their class.

Hi, I had some questions about applying to be on course staff:

1. For which classes is the TA application still open for Spring 2022?

2. What is expected to be on the resume for an application to be a TA or a reader?

3. In the 'experience' section, can you mention your tutoring experiences in high school?

4. How many hours are you expected to work - and what should you consider when putting down how many hours you want to work on your application?

5. What are the differences between the different positions (AI, reader, tutor, TA)?

Thank you!
history.subject: Applying to be on course staff
